== Re-Approval Application for Ubuntu Morocco (ubuntu-ma) ==
<<BR>><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[File:MoroccanTeam/logo-officiel.png]]</nowiki>
<<BR>><<BR>><<BR>>
The Ubuntu MoroccanTeam is a group of enthusiastic people dedicated to spreading Ubuntu in Morocco. We often get together at conventions, meetings, parties, and online

The team, which has been active for more than 4 years, consists of Ubuntu users from all over Morocco. Our varied membership reflects the diversity of languages in Morocco: Moroccan Arabic, Arabic, French, Berber and Spanish.

For us, giving Ubuntu love and support doesn't stop at Moroccan's border. Many team members also participate in other groups on Launchpad such as Ubuntu, Kubuntu, Edubuntu, Documentation Team, French and Arabic Translators, BugSquad and so on. 

Of course, we have also some active Ubuntu members.

=== Key Details ===

* '''Date''' - 29th October 2011
* '''Team Contact''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~waver|Hassan El Jacifi]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~daker|Adnane Belmadiaf]]</nowiki>
* '''Membership''' - 174 <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-moroccan-users|launchpad members]]</nowiki> as of 29th Oct 2011
* '''Homepage''' - http://www.ubuntu-ma.org
* '''Mailing List''' - ubuntu-ma on lists.ubuntu.com (181 subscribers as of 29th Oct 2011)
* '''IRC''' - #ubuntu-ma on Freenode
* '''Regional Contacts''' - https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MoroccanTeam/Members
* '''Facebook''' - 744 <nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/groups/ubuntuma/|members]]</nowiki> as of 29th Oct 2011

=== Roadmap ===

The Moroccan Loco Team aims to promote Ubuntu and its flavors in Morocco. This is done through:

* Install parties
* Stands at fairs
* Presentations and speeches at various events
* Regular meetings on IRC channel #ubuntu-ma
* Giving support, CDs and info in the various Moroccan regions, in all Moroccan official languages. See also the list of <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MoroccanTeam/Members|local contact]]</nowiki> persons grouped by location.
* Active collaboration in translations into German, French, Italian and, hopefully soon also Romansh.
